forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 45. West wind 6 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 51, with temperatures falling to around 43 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 14 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

weather_report:
As the sun dips beneath the horizon in Boston, a tranquil stillness blankets the city. Tonight, the air is primarily clear, with a crispness suggestive of the autumn season, and temperatures lingering around 45 degrees. A gentle west wind stirs, whispering through the trees at speeds that tell tales of the coming chill, gusting occasionally, reminding residents of winter's growing proximity. 

Tomorrow promises a sunny embrace, although the warmth may quickly recede as afternoon shadows hint at the cooler climes. With a high near 51, conditions will be brisk, ideal for putting on a light jacket that can be shed as the sun makes its appearance. Such a clear day provides inviting opportunities—perhaps a leisurely stroll through the nearby parks or a visit to one of the local cafés, where the warmth of freshly brewed coffee can be enjoyed inside while gazing at the lively streets outside. For those inclined to savor the evening, a gathering of friends on a patio, comfortably bundled and sharing stories, could be the perfect way to welcome the shift into colder nights.
